com.paco.java.subway.virtual

Interface INodeLinker

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NodeLinker, NodeLinkTable

    public interface INodeLinker
    Author:
    Pascal Interface used for the NodeLinker and NodeLinkTable classes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int ComputeOptimalDistance(INodeLinker oLink)
      This method will obtain the optimal (shortest) path between itself and the 2 node obtained in the parameter link
      INodeLinker getAlternatePath() 
      INodeLinker getCommonPath(INodeLinker otherPath)
      This function will search for a common non null INodeLinker element.
      int getDistance() 
      Node getFirsttNode() 
      Node getSecondNode() 
      boolean isMorePath()
      This function will tell if we have a case of multiple paths
      void setAlternateLink(INodeLinker newPath)
      This function allows the addition of a new Path that will need to be computed and compared with the chosen path and any other alternate paths
      void setDistance(int iDistance) 
      void setSecondNode(Node oNode) 

    • Method Detail

      • getFirsttNode

        Node getFirsttNode()

        INodeLinker getAlternatePath()

      • setSecondNode

        void setSecondNode(Node oNode)

      • setDistance

        void setDistance(int iDistance)

      • setAlternateLink

        void setAlternateLink(INodeLinker newPath)
        This function allows the addition of a new Path that will need to be computed and compared with the chosen path and any other alternate paths
        Parameters:
        newPath - A non null INodeLinker object

      • getCommonPath

        INodeLinker getCommonPath(INodeLinker otherPath)
        This function will search for a common non null INodeLinker element. If found it will return that element, otherwise null will be returned
        Parameters:
        otherPath - A non null INodeLinker (probably of NodeLinkTable type) that will be compared to this
        Returns:
        Return null if no common nodes are found or the common element if founded

      • isMorePath

        boolean isMorePath()
        This function will tell if we have a case of multiple paths
        Returns:
        true if more than one valid path exists

      • ComputeOptimalDistance

        int ComputeOptimalDistance(INodeLinker oLink)
        This method will obtain the optimal (shortest) path between itself and the 2 node obtained in the parameter link
        Parameters:
        oLink - A non null INodeLinker instance
        Returns:
        A positive number corresponding to the distance between the elements
